H0.text: Which mountain peak is the highest point in the Western Hemisphere. Denali (formerly known as Mount McKinley)

H1.text: Which mountain peak is the highest point in the Western Hemisphere. Ojos del Salado

H2.text: Which mountain peak is the highest point in the Western Hemisphere. Monte Pissis

H3.text: Which mountain peak is the highest point in the Western Hemisphere. ACONCAGUA

A4.text: the same party later used geodetic methods to establish the elevation of Ojos del Salado as 6,885.5 ± 3 metres (22,590.2 ± 9.8 ft) and lower than the 6,960 metres (22,830 ft) high Aconcagua

A5.text: During the middle of the 20th century there was a debate on whether Ojos del Salado or Aconcagua was the highest mountain in South America which was eventually resolved in favour of Aconcagua

A6.text: Monte Pissis is the third-highest mountain in the Western Hemisphere.

A7.text: The 2007 Chilean-Argentine-European expedition found Monte Pissis to be 6,793 m (22,287 ft), lower than Ojos del Salado's 6,891 m (22,608 ft).

A8.text: Aconcagua is the highest mountain in the Western Hemisphere

A9.text: Aconcagua CSA (Continental South America) elevation is 6,967.15 m
